sentence.Network_en: His annoyance had unbridled his tongue.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的烦恼使他打开了话匣子.

sentence.Network_en: Memories have been in unbridled spread.
sentence.Network_cn: 回忆一直在肆无忌惮的蔓延。

sentence.Network_en: I was amazed at their unbridled glee.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们那兴高采烈的痛快劲儿真让我吃惊.

encyclopedia.content: 这是一个英语成语。 音标：[ʌnˈbraɪdld] 中文翻译：肆无忌惮；不受约束的；不受控制的；放纵的 ； 中文近义词：肆意妄为 中文反义词：规行矩步、循规蹈矩 英语近义词：brazen; unscrupulous; unprincipled; wanton（全部都是英语，很少见的） 解释：肆：放肆；忌：顾忌；惮：音但，害怕。非常放肆，一点没有顾忌。 出处：西汉·戴圣《礼记·中庸》：“小人之中庸也；小人而无忌惮也。 宋·朱熹注：“

entry.tran: 无约束的；放肆的；放纵的
entry.def: If you describe behaviour or feelings as unbridled, you mean that they are not controlled or limited in any way.

example.tran: 20世纪80年代贪得无厌的社会风气

example.ex: ...a tale of lust and unbridled passion.

auth_sentence.content: Nobanda continues to display an unbridled passion for drumming.
